page.title: 04CASTLE MOUND
page.content: Leigh Sinton is rich in local history. For instance Castle Mound which is quite near the village. If you turn down Sherridge Road from the village turn off on the first turning right down a track . Follow that track until you come to a big farm. Castle Mound is directly north from there. If you go north from there you come to the Inner Bailey. If you go north west from there you come to the west side of the mound. If you go north east there were other traces of enclosures but they are now obliterated . At the end of the track if you look straight ahead you can see a sort of stable porch way and above that there is a barn. The barn was built in the 16th century and is going to be taken to a museum. It is on the property of Castle Green Farm.
